Further rambling about my scenarios and why I don't want a follow-up 
to my scenarios:

Technically, there are only 49.  Originally, I attached a scenario 
number #204 from my personal collection.  That would have made 50.

[If I ever decide to do a follow-up and the game has improved enough 
to handle a follow-up, I'll start from right where I left off.  There 
are some unresolved plots left to take care of.]

Some of my illegitimate characters have had trouble beating some of 
those scenarios unless cheating occurred: freezing time, summoning 
fire elementals, or artifically increasing the amount of magical 
energy available.  I left things off where opponents would have to be 
at experience 20+.  That means I can no longer uses mages as opponents 
(freezing time could wipe out teams).  I am concerned about using 
archmages because of potential system freezes caused by 
chain-lightning; if I use such high experience archmages I can't give 
enough NPC help without the aforementioned risk.  In one of my 
scenarios, you originally had a lot more NPC help, until I ran into 
heartburst/chain lightning problems with the opponent.

Oh yea, elves at those experience levels could stay in a forest and 
keep attacking without running out of energy except for brief moments. 
 That would mean I can't use elves or large forested maps.

Druids at those experience levels could keep you busy cleaning out 
their waves of protection (game issue) for dead characters because you 
special attacks don't work against waves of protection (game issue).  
Thieves could run around invisible, forcing you to resort attacking 
random areas or using heartburst/chain lightning attack.  Faerie 
opponets basically nuetralize mages/archmages with one blow [one 
attack can keep an archmage/mage frozen for 30+ minutes].
